fields.Title: A Randomized Control Trial of the Effects of Healing Touch for Newborn Male Infant Circumcision Inpatients
fields.Outlet (if applicable): St. Luke's Health System Center for Research Excellence
fields.Description/Abstract:
Purpose/Aims: To enable holistic nurses to utilize evidence-based practice (EBP) promoting health through practice application of complementary therapies in a health care setting. The study purpose determines effects of Healing Touch therapy (HT) in addition to the Current Standard of Nursing Care (CSNC) on the pain scores, oxygenation and heart rates of newborn male infants undergoing the circumcision procedure. This is a double-blind randomized-control trial. 
Partners:  St. Luke's Health System Center for Research Excellence
Description of Partner:  St. Luke's Research Fellowhship nurses and Coordinator of the Center for Research Excellence and Boise State University School of Nursing faculty mentors collaborate on research and evidence-based projects to enhance nursing and patient care within the Health System. In this research study, Dr. Marty Downey mentors Laurie Bourn throughout the research study. 
Role:  Co-Principal
